title: SS.PT.315
prompt:
Use the graph to decide whether each statement is true or false.

The civilian labor force increased from 2006 to 2014.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3142_259]

The number of people employed dropped sharply from 2008 to 2010.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3142_260]

The number of people employed has declined since 2010.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3142_261]

The unemployment rate rose from 2008 to 2010.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3142_262]

The unemployment rate changed rapidly from 2005 to 2008.
![dropdown:Drop_Down_3142_263]
feedback: The graph shows that the civilian labor force increased from 148,000,000 (the graph lists numbers in “thousands of persons”) in 2006 to 156,000,000 in 2014. The number of people employed dropped by about 8,000,000 from 2008 to 2010. The space between the lines for civilian workforce and civilian employment widened from 2008 to 2010, indicating a rise in unemployment. Since 2010 the number of people employed has increased. The difference between the two lines in the graph remained the same from 2005 to 2010, indicating that the unemployment rate did not change.
